title: 109_s1712
content: The Act may be cited as the "Homeland Security Management Restructuring Act of 2005". It establishes the position of Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish the positions of Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security and Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management. Vacancy procedures are outlined in case of absence or vacancy in the office of the Secretary. In the absence or disability of the Secretary of Homeland Security, the Deputy Secretary may fulfill the duties of the office. If both the Secretary and Deputy Secretary are unavailable, the Deputy Secretary for Management will act as Secretary. In case of a vacancy in the office of the Deputy Secretary, procedures are outlined. In the event of a vacancy or absence of the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security, the Deputy Secretary for Management can assume the duties of the office. The Secretary has the authority to designate other officers in further succession to act as Secretary. The Deputy Secretary for Management serves as the Chief Management Officer and principal advisor. The Deputy Secretary for Management serves as the Chief Management Officer and principal advisor to the Secretary on matters related to the management of the Department, including management integration and transformation in support of homeland security operations and programs. The Deputy Secretary for Management can assume the duties of the office in the absence of the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security. The text discusses the integration and transformation process within the Department of Homeland Security, including the appointment, evaluation, and reappointment of the Deputy Secretary for Management. The Deputy Secretary for Management serves as the Chief Management Officer and principal advisor to the Secretary on management matters. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management is appointed by the President with Senate approval, based on leadership and management experience, skills, and ability to achieve results. They serve a 5-year term, subject to removal by the Secretary for unsatisfactory performance, and may be reappointed. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management may be reappointed if satisfactory performance is determined for the 3 most recent years. They must enter into an annual performance agreement with measurable goals and undergo an annual evaluation by the Secretary. The Under Secretary for Management incumbent at the time of this Act's enactment is also mentioned. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management, under this Act, can perform duties until a new Deputy Secretary is appointed and may be appointed Deputy Secretary if in accordance with relevant sections of the Homeland Security Act of 2002. References to the Under Secretary for Management shall now refer to the Deputy Secretary. Homeland Security now refers to the Deputy Secretary for Management. Technical amendments include updating references in the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management is added to the Executive schedule in the United States Code.
